Will be completely honest and say I haven't tried the rework myself yet, though here's what I think of it so far:


Passive: Glad they got rid of the previous one. Havn't seen the numbers on the movement speed yet, although will probably be an OK ability.


Q: Really glad they didnt touch any of its mechanics (still circular delayed ability with movement speed increase)


W: Will probably make her gameplay against mobile champions somewhat easier. Will be so much fun counterplay in this :)


E: TLDR version: Dont like. Miss the reset mechanic. 1s will make her feel slow early game (0.55s with 45% CDR, which will feel like the old one.) Balance issues.

Long version:
I actually REALLY dont like the changes they did to this ability, primarily due to balance and difficulty concerns (I liked the harsh punishment for missing poisons). Here's why I'm afraid of her future balancing: As it's supposed to be now, you get a flat 1s CD on her E, with increased dmg if the target is poisoned. Now this can be balanced by giving the ability low dmg if the target isn't poisoned, and OK damage if poisoned. 

Now what if I decide to buy Rylai's? You would pretty much be able to start of by casting 1 E to trigger the slow, follow up by her poisons (which are really hard to avoid because of the slow), and then you just continue with the "old combo". Now my question is how are you supposed to balance this? I'm afraid she'll either end up being completely overpowered (and thereby permabanned), or completely useless because they have to balance around this.

I also feel like the changes reduces the difference between a good Cassio player and a crap one by a huge amount (High skill ceiling pretty much removed)


R: Unchanged as far as I can tell. Quite happy it stayed the way it is.


Overall: Don't like changes to E. I think it makes her way to easy to play, and removes her completely from the "hard champion pool". Also may create balance issues. Quite happy with the rest of her kit (although, for me, the E changes overshadow the rest of her kit's changes).

Understandable feedback, especially as it pertains to E. The whole spell didn't go to PBE with the update, but the W is harder to use than old Miasma, so if you're looking for a challenge, the new replacement spell does provide that.

I know this won't make your job any easier, but please consider moving away from machine gun cass. That playstyle is exceedingly unfun to play as and play against, as it is the mage version of a stat check (did i land a poison, and can I hit E enough times before they burst me?) that used to be such a problem in top lane.

Have you guys thought about a % magic pen on a spell? Like {{champion:122}} and {{champion:6}} E. Because right now it feels like every game to do any damage mid game she's gonna have to rush {{item:3136}}. We are probably already doomed to {{item:3040}} being core like it is now. And both those items are near 5k gold for just a stacking mana item and 15 magic pen. Having to build those same items every single game will feel quite boring.

I agree with you on the E changes making it easier (maybe too easy), but I don't see your balance concerns? Perma-slowing with Rylai's is something you can already do right now, and it doesn't make her overpowered. Hell, you can even combine the perma-Rylai's slow with a perma-speed boost from Furor boot enchant for extra sillyness (which her new passive will prevent). So I don't see how her still being able to do that post-rework will make her unbalancable. Especially since, even if you can perma-slow, she's likely going to be dealing less damage in the combo than she does now. They said damage is gonna be shifted away from E towards her Q. So reduced damage E, combined with E being less spammable without investing into CDR, plus inability to get Furor, seems to me like if anything the Rylai's combo is being nerfed from live.

No access to Sorcerer's Shoes or Ionian Boots of Lucidity? CDR might be relatively common, but no access to one of the only viable flat MPen items screws Cassio over against Hexdrinker and Maw, especially in the mid-game.
